title: Application of an Iterative Instructional Design Model to Enhance Graduate Teaching Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience in mathematics instruction and foundational understanding of instructional design
context.additional_context: Current professionals performing mathematics education-related tasks, familiar with smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: Learners can systematically develop math teaching strategies in three or more phases (design-implementation-reflection) using an iterative instructional design model.
Learners can establish content creation plans using LMS tools to design math pedagogical approaches based on learner analytics.
Learners can refine and apply developed teaching methods at least twice through peer feedback and self-assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
